name: partition-poland
description: Russia, Prussia, and Austria carved up Polish territory.

name: articles-confederation
description: The first constitution of the United States was ratified.

name: constitutional-convention
description: Delegates gathered in Philadelphia to draft the US Constitution.

name: us-constitution
description: The United States adopted its constitution establishing the federal government.

name: first-fleet-australia
description: British ships established a penal colony at Sydney Cove.

name: french-declaration-rights
friendly_name: Declaration of the Rights of Man
description: Revolutionary France proclaimed fundamental rights and freedoms.

name: dc-established
description: The District of Columbia was established as the U.S. capital after the Residence Act was signed.

name: bill-of-rights-us
description: The first ten amendments to the US Constitution were adopted.

name: library-congress-established
description: President John Adams signed legislation establishing the Library of Congress.

name: louisiana-purchase
description: The United States bought vast territories from France, doubling its size.

name: haitian-independence
description: Haiti became the first nation founded by a successful slave revolt.

name: congress-vienna
description: European powers redrew the map after Napoleon's defeat.

name: concert-europe
description: Great powers agreed to maintain stability and suppress revolution.

name: missouri-compromise
description: Congress balanced free and slave states while admitting Missouri.

name: latin-american-independence
description: Mexico and other Spanish colonies gained independence in rapid succession.

name: monroe-doctrine
description: The US opposed European colonization in the Americas.

name: bolivia-independence
description: The Bolivian Declaration of Independence was proclaimed.

name: belgian-independence
description: Belgium gained independence from the Netherlands after revolution.

name: indian-removal-act
description: President Andrew Jackson signed the Indian Removal Act, forcibly relocating Native Americans.

name: treaty-waitangi
description: Britain and Māori chiefs signed the founding document of New Zealand.

name: treaty-nanking
description: China ceded Hong Kong to Britain after the First Opium War.

name: compromise-slavery
description: Congress attempted to balance free and slave state interests as US territories expanded.

name: red-cross-founded
description: Henry Dunant established the humanitarian organization in Geneva.

name: emancipation-proclamation
description: Lincoln declared slaves in Confederate states to be free.

name: geneva-convention-first
description: Nations agreed to protect wounded soldiers and medical personnel in war.

name: 13th-amendment
description: The United States abolished slavery through constitutional amendment.

name: dominion-canada
description: Canadian provinces united to form a self-governing dominion within the British Empire.

name: british-north-america-act
description: The act created the Dominion of Canada from British colonies.

name: meiji-restoration
description: Japan restored imperial rule and began rapid modernization.

name: triple-alliance
description: Germany, Austria-Hungary, and Italy formed a mutual defense pact.

name: berlin-conference
description: European powers divided Africa among themselves without African participation.

name: first-zionist-congress
description: Theodor Herzl organized the movement for a Jewish homeland.

name: hague-conventions
description: International treaties established rules of warfare and peaceful dispute resolution.

name: commonwealth-australia
description: Australian colonies federated to form a single nation.

name: entente-cordiale
description: Britain and France signed agreements ending centuries of rivalry.

name: triple-entente
description: Britain, France, and Russia aligned against the Triple Alliance.

name: naacp-founded
description: The civil rights organization was established to fight racial discrimination.

name: chinese-republic
description: The Qing Dynasty fell and China became a republic.

name: anc-founded
description: The ANC was founded as the South African Native National Congress to fight for Black rights.

name: last-emperor-china-abdicates
description: The Xuantong Emperor abdicated, ending over 2,000 years of imperial rule in China.

name: ilo-founded
description: The ILO was created to promote workers' rights worldwide.

name: league-of-nations
description: The first international organization for world peace was established.

name: womens-suffrage-us
description: American women gained the constitutional right to vote.

name: treaty-versailles-effect
description: The Treaty of Versailles officially ended World War I for most combatant nations.

name: prohibition-begins-us
description: Alcohol prohibition began in the United States as the Volstead Act took effect.

name: irish-free-state
description: Ireland gained independence from Britain as a dominion.

name: ussr-formed
description: The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics was officially established.

name: washington-naval-treaty
description: Major powers agreed to limit their naval fleets to prevent an arms race.

name: anglo-irish-treaty
description: Dail Eireann ratified the Anglo-Irish Treaty by 64-57 vote, establishing the Irish Free State.

name: dawes-plan
description: The plan restructured German reparations payments after World War I.

name: locarno-treaties
description: European nations agreed to mutual borders and peaceful relations.

name: kellogg-briand-pact
description: Nations agreed to renounce war as an instrument of national policy.

name: statute-westminster
description: British dominions gained legislative independence from the UK Parliament.

name: kingdom-saudi-arabia-founded
description: Ibn Saud unified the Arabian Peninsula into a single kingdom.

name: manchukuo-established
description: Japan created the puppet state of Manchukuo in Manchuria, installing former Chinese Emperor Puyi.

name: new-deal
description: FDR launched sweeping programs to combat the Great Depression.

name: social-security-act
description: The US established its social insurance program for the elderly.

name: anti-comintern-pact
description: Germany and Japan agreed to oppose international communism.

name: rhineland-remilitarization
description: In violation of Versailles and Locarno treaties, Germany remilitarized the Rhineland.

name: atlantic-charter
description: Churchill and Roosevelt outlined Allied war aims and postwar goals.

name: declaration-united-nations
description: Twenty-six nations signed the Declaration by United Nations during World War II.

name: imf-world-bank
description: The Bretton Woods Conference created the international financial institutions.

name: united-nations-founded
description: Fifty-one nations established the international organization for peace and cooperation.

name: yalta-conference
description: Allied leaders met to plan the postwar reorganization of Europe.

name: potsdam-conference
description: Allied leaders finalized postwar arrangements for Germany and Europe.

name: first-un-general-assembly
description: The first General Assembly of the United Nations assembles in London with 51 nations represented.

name: indian-independence
description: India gained independence from British rule and was partitioned with Pakistan.

name: marshall-plan
description: The US announced massive economic aid to rebuild Western Europe.

name: gatt-established
description: Nations agreed to reduce tariffs and promote free trade.

name: universal-declaration-rights
description: The United Nations adopted the landmark document on human rights.

name: israel-founded
description: Israel declared independence as a Jewish homeland.

name: berlin-airlift
description: Western powers supplied West Berlin by air during the Soviet blockade.

name: burma-independence
description: Burma gains independence from the United Kingdom, becoming the Union of Burma.

name: nato-founded
description: Western nations formed a military alliance for collective defense.

name: geneva-conventions-modern
description: Nations adopted comprehensive humanitarian law for armed conflicts.

name: prc-founded
description: Mao Zedong proclaimed the founding of communist China.

name: indian-constitution-enacted
description: The Constitution of India comes into force, forming a republic with Rajendra Prasad as first President.

name: european-coal-steel
description: Six nations created the first European supranational organization.

name: elizabeth-ii-becomes-queen
description: Elizabeth II becomes Queen of the United Kingdom upon the death of her father, George VI.

name: brown-v-board
description: The Supreme Court ruled school segregation unconstitutional.

name: seato-formed
description: Southeast Asian nations formed a collective defense treaty with Western powers.

name: warsaw-pact
description: The Soviet Union and Eastern Bloc formed a military alliance.

name: bandung-conference
description: African and Asian nations met to promote cooperation and oppose colonialism.

name: sudan-independence
description: Sudan achieves independence from Egypt and the United Kingdom.

name: treaty-rome
description: Six nations created the European Economic Community.

name: efta-formed
description: Seven European nations formed a free trade alternative to the EEC.

name: opec-founded
description: Oil-producing nations formed a cartel to control petroleum prices.

name: decolonization-africa
description: Seventeen African nations gained independence from European colonial powers.

name: indus-water-treaty
description: India and Pakistan signed a water-sharing treaty brokered by the World Bank.

name: us-japan-mutual-security-treaty
description: Japan and the United States sign the Mutual Security Treaty.

name: non-aligned-movement
description: Nations refused to align with either Cold War superpower bloc.

name: cuban-missile-resolution
description: The US and USSR reached an agreement to remove missiles from Cuba and Turkey.

name: test-ban-treaty
description: The US, UK, and USSR agreed to ban nuclear tests in the atmosphere.

name: civil-rights-act
description: The US outlawed discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

name: 24th-amendment-ratified
description: The 24th Amendment, prohibiting poll taxes in national elections, is ratified.

name: voting-rights-act
description: The US prohibited racial discrimination in voting.

name: singapore-independence
description: Singapore separated from Malaysia to become an independent nation.

name: apollo-11-treaty
description: Nations agreed that space should be free for exploration and cannot be claimed.

name: asean-founded
description: Five Southeast Asian nations formed an association for regional cooperation.

name: nuclear-non-proliferation
description: Nations agreed to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons.

name: china-un-seat
description: The People's Republic of China replaced Taiwan on the UN Security Council.

name: nixon-china
description: President Nixon's visit opened diplomatic relations between the US and China.

name: salt-i
description: The US and USSR signed the first Strategic Arms Limitation Treaty.

name: paris-peace-accords-1973
description: The agreement led to a ceasefire and U.S. withdrawal from Vietnam.

name: helsinki-accords
description: East and West agreed on security, cooperation, and human rights.

name: camp-david-accords
description: Egypt and Israel signed a peace agreement brokered by the US.

name: reform-opening-china
description: Deng Xiaoping launched economic reforms that transformed China into a market economy.

name: iran-revolution
description: Iran became an Islamic theocracy after the revolution.

name: salt-ii
description: The US and USSR agreed to further limits on nuclear weapons.

name: egypt-israel-peace
description: Egypt became the first Arab nation to sign a peace treaty with Israel.

name: solidarity-poland
description: Polish workers formed the first independent labor union in a Soviet bloc country.

name: constitution-canada-patriation
description: Canada gained full sovereignty with the ability to amend its own constitution.

name: european-union-precursor
description: European nations agreed to create a single market.

name: start-i
description: The US and USSR signed the first Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty.

name: maastricht-treaty
description: The treaty created the European Union and planned a common currency.

name: nafta-signed
description: The North American Free Trade Agreement created a trade bloc between the US, Canada, and Mexico.

name: oslo-accords
description: Israel and the PLO signed agreements toward Palestinian self-governance.

name: wto-founded
description: The international organization for trade rules and negotiations was established.

name: dayton-accords
description: The agreement ended the war in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

name: schengen-area
description: European nations abolished border controls for passport-free travel.

name: kyoto-protocol
description: Nations agreed to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to combat climate change.

name: hong-kong-handover
description: Britain returned Hong Kong to China after 156 years of colonial rule.

name: good-friday-agreement
description: A peace agreement largely ended decades of conflict in Northern Ireland.

name: rome-statute-icc
description: Nations agreed to establish the International Criminal Court.

name: euro-introduced
description: Eleven European nations adopted a common currency.

name: macau-handover
description: Portugal returned Macau to China after over 400 years of colonial rule.

name: china-wto-entry
description: China joined the World Trade Organization, accelerating its global economic integration.

name: icc-established
description: The first permanent international court for war crimes was established.

name: african-union
description: African nations formed a continental union for political and economic integration.

name: eu-eastern-expansion
description: Ten countries joined the European Union in its largest single expansion.

name: same-sex-marriage-canada
description: Canada became the fourth country to legalize same-sex marriage nationwide.

name: asean-charter
description: Southeast Asian nations adopted a charter giving ASEAN legal status.

name: lisbon-treaty
description: The EU reformed its institutions and created a permanent president.

name: belt-road-initiative
description: China announced a massive global infrastructure investment strategy.

name: paris-climate-agreement
description: Nearly 200 nations agreed to limit global warming to well below 2°C.

name: iran-nuclear-deal
description: World powers reached an agreement to limit Iran's nuclear program.

name: inter-korean-summit-2018
description: Leaders of North and South Korea met for the first time in over a decade.

name: brexit
description: The United Kingdom officially left the European Union.

name: abraham-accords
description: UAE and Bahrain normalized relations with Israel.

name: lend-lease-act
description: The US began supplying Allied nations with military aid before entering World War II.

name: treaty-paris-1783
description: Britain formally recognized American independence, ending the Revolutionary War.

name: delhi-sultanate
description: Qutb ud-Din Aibak founded the first of five dynasties that ruled northern India.

name: british-raj-established
description: The British Crown assumed direct control of India after the Sepoy Mutiny.

name: german-reunification
description: East and West Germany united into a single nation after the fall of the Berlin Wall.

name: montreal-protocol
description: Nations agreed to phase out ozone-depleting substances in the most successful environmental treaty.

name: thatcher-becomes-pm
description: Britain's first female Prime Minister began transforming British politics and economics.

name: unification-egypt
friendly_name: Unification of Upper and Lower Egypt
description: Narmer unified Egypt under the First Dynasty, creating one of the world's first nation-states.

name: zhou-dynasty-begins
description: The Zhou overthrew the Shang, beginning China's longest-lasting dynasty.

name: darius-i-persian-king
description: Darius I seized the throne and expanded the Persian Empire to its greatest extent.

name: first-secession-plebs
description: Roman plebeians withdrew from the city, winning political representation through tribunes.

name: athens-surrenders-sparta
description: Athens surrendered after the Peloponnesian War, ending its golden age of democracy.

name: battle-chaeronea
description: Philip II of Macedon defeated Athens and Thebes, gaining control over Greece.

name: death-alexander-great
description: Alexander died in Babylon at 32, leaving his vast empire without a clear successor.

name: ptolemaic-kingdom-established
description: Ptolemy I founded a Greek dynasty in Egypt that would rule until Cleopatra's death.

name: seleucid-empire-founded
description: Seleucus I established an empire spanning from Anatolia to the borders of India.

name: battle-ipsus
description: The Diadochi fought a decisive battle that divided Alexander's empire among his successors.

name: lex-hortensia
description: This law gave the Plebeian Council full legislative power, equalizing Roman social classes.

name: tiberius-gracchus-reforms
description: Tiberius Gracchus proposed radical land reforms, triggering political violence in Rome.

name: marian-reforms
description: Gaius Marius professionalized the Roman army, allowing landless citizens to serve.

name: social-war-rome
description: Italian allies rebelled against Rome, eventually winning Roman citizenship.

name: sullas-civil-war
description: Sulla marched on Rome and became dictator, setting a precedent for later strongmen.

name: first-triumvirate
description: Caesar, Pompey, and Crassus formed an informal alliance to dominate Roman politics.

name: second-triumvirate
description: Octavian, Antony, and Lepidus formed a legal dictatorship to avenge Caesar's death.

name: death-of-augustus
description: Rome's first emperor died after 40 years of rule, establishing the model for succession.

name: nero-becomes-emperor
description: The young Nero became emperor, beginning a reign that would end in tyranny and suicide.

name: trajan-becomes-emperor
description: Trajan became emperor, expanding Rome to its greatest territorial extent.

name: hadrian-becomes-emperor
description: Hadrian succeeded Trajan, consolidating the empire and building his famous wall in Britain.

name: marcus-aurelius-emperor
description: The philosopher-emperor Marcus Aurelius began his reign, the last of the Five Good Emperors.

name: jin-dynasty-reunifies-china
description: The Jin Dynasty ended the Three Kingdoms period, briefly reunifying China.

name: fall-western-jin
description: Northern China fell to nomadic invaders, beginning centuries of division.

name: council-of-constantinople
description: Church council affirmed the Nicene Creed and defined the doctrine of the Trinity.

name: division-roman-empire
description: The Roman Empire permanently split into Western and Eastern halves after Theodosius's death.

name: ravenna-becomes-capital
description: The Western Roman capital moved from Milan to Ravenna for better defense.

name: council-of-ephesus
description: Church council declared Mary the 'Mother of God' and condemned Nestorianism.

name: death-of-muhammad
description: The Prophet Muhammad died in Medina, sparking debates over succession that still echo today.

name: islamic-conquest-spain
description: Umayyad forces crossed into Iberia, beginning nearly 800 years of Muslim presence in Spain.

name: charlemagne-king-franks
description: Charlemagne became sole king of the Franks, beginning his path to reuniting Western Europe.

name: death-of-charlemagne
description: Charlemagne died, and his empire was eventually divided among his grandsons.

name: alfred-great-king
description: Alfred became King of Wessex and would defend England against Viking invasion.

name: fall-tang-dynasty
description: China's Tang Dynasty collapsed, beginning the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period.

name: fatimid-caliphate-established
description: The Shia Fatimid dynasty established a caliphate in North Africa.

name: treaty-saint-clair-sur-epte
description: Vikings received Normandy from the French king, founding the Norman dynasty.

name: canute-king-england
description: The Danish king Canute conquered England, ruling a North Sea empire.

name: seljuk-empire-founded
description: The Seljuk Turks established an empire that would dominate the Middle East.

name: death-genghis-khan
description: Genghis Khan died, leaving an empire that would continue expanding under his successors.

name: model-parliament
description: Edward I summoned a parliament including commoners, establishing a template for representative government.

name: philip-vi-france
friendly_name: Philip VI Becomes King of France
description: The first Valois king's accession sparked the succession crisis that led to the Hundred Years' War.

name: treaty-of-bretigny
description: England and France agreed to a temporary peace, with England gaining territory in exchange for renouncing claims to the French throne.

name: marriage-ferdinand-isabella
description: The union of Aragon and Castile's heirs laid the foundation for a unified Spain.

name: henry-viii-becomes-king
description: The 17-year-old Tudor prince inherited England's throne, beginning a transformative reign.

name: charles-v-king-spain
friendly_name: Charles V Becomes King of Spain
description: The Habsburg prince inherited Spain, beginning an empire on which the sun never set.

name: charles-v-holy-roman-emperor
friendly_name: Charles V Elected Holy Roman Emperor
description: Charles V's election united Spain, the Netherlands, Austria, and the Holy Roman Empire under one ruler.

name: field-of-cloth-of-gold
friendly_name: Field of the Cloth of Gold
description: Henry VIII and Francis I met in an extravagant diplomatic summit that failed to secure lasting alliance.

name: neanderthals-thrive-europe
description: Neanderthals dominated Europe for over 200,000 years, developing sophisticated tools and social structures before modern humans arrived.

name: first-irrigation-systems
description: Ancient Mesopotamians developed canal systems to control water flow, enabling large-scale agriculture and the rise of civilization.

name: minoan-civilization-peak
description: The Minoan civilization on Crete reached its height, building elaborate palaces like Knossos and dominating Aegean trade.

name: abrahams-journey-traditional
description: According to tradition, Abraham migrated from Ur to Canaan, establishing the covenant that founded the Abrahamic faiths.

name: david-establishes-jerusalem-capital
description: King David captured Jerusalem from the Jebusites and made it the political and religious capital of the united Israelite kingdom.

name: assyrian-empire-expansion
description: The Neo-Assyrian Empire began aggressive expansion, becoming the first true empire to rule much of the ancient Near East.

name: fall-of-israel-northern-kingdom
description: Assyria conquered the northern Kingdom of Israel, deporting its population and ending the Ten Tribes as a distinct entity.

name: fall-of-nineveh
description: A coalition of Babylonians and Medes destroyed Nineveh, ending the Assyrian Empire after centuries of dominance.

name: caesar-invades-britain
description: Julius Caesar led two expeditions to Britain, the first Roman military operations on the island, though no permanent conquest resulted.

name: five-good-emperors-era-begins
description: Nerva's accession began Rome's most stable period, with emperors chosen by merit rather than heredity for nearly a century.

name: end-of-pax-romana
description: The death of Marcus Aurelius ended two centuries of relative peace and prosperity, beginning Rome's slow decline.

name: visigoths-settle-aquitaine
description: Rome granted the Visigoths land in southwestern Gaul as foederati, establishing the first Germanic kingdom within the empire.

name: theodoric-establishes-ostrogothic-kingdom
description: Theodoric the Great conquered Italy and established the Ostrogothic Kingdom, preserving Roman institutions under Gothic rule.

name: baghdad-founded
description: Caliph al-Mansur founded Baghdad as the new Abbasid capital, which became the world's largest city and center of learning.

name: treaty-of-aachen
description: The Byzantine Empire recognized Charlemagne as Emperor of the West, acknowledging the permanent division of the Roman legacy.

name: rurik-founds-novgorod
description: The Varangian prince Rurik established rule at Novgorod, founding the dynasty that would rule Russia for over 700 years.

name: fatimids-conquer-egypt
description: The Fatimid Caliphate conquered Egypt and founded Cairo, establishing a rival Shia caliphate to challenge Abbasid authority.

name: seljuk-turks-capture-baghdad
description: The Seljuk Turks entered Baghdad and became the real power behind the Abbasid caliphs, reshaping the Islamic world.

name: investiture-controversy-begins
description: Pope Gregory VII and Emperor Henry IV clashed over the right to appoint church officials, sparking a decades-long power struggle.

name: walk-to-canossa
description: Emperor Henry IV stood barefoot in the snow for three days seeking Pope Gregory VII's forgiveness after excommunication.

name: toledo-reconquered
description: Alfonso VI of Castile captured Toledo, a major Reconquista victory that recovered the former Visigothic capital from Muslim rule.

name: fall-of-edessa
description: Zengi captured the Crusader County of Edessa, the first Crusader state to fall, triggering the Second Crusade.

name: minamoto-yoritomo-becomes-shogun
description: Minamoto Yoritomo was named shogun, establishing the Kamakura shogunate and beginning seven centuries of samurai rule in Japan.

name: mamluks-take-power-egypt
description: The Mamluks, former slave soldiers, seized power in Egypt and would later halt the Mongol advance at Ain Jalut.

name: sicilian-vespers
description: A popular uprising in Palermo led to the massacre of French Angevins, ending French rule and bringing Aragon to power in Sicily.

name: henry-iv-deposes-richard-ii
description: Henry Bolingbroke deposed Richard II and became Henry IV, founding the Lancastrian dynasty and setting the stage for civil war.

name: council-of-florence
description: The Council attempted to reunite the Eastern and Western churches, briefly achieving union before Byzantine rejection.

name: portuguese-capture-goa
description: Afonso de Albuquerque conquered Goa, establishing it as the capital of Portuguese India and a major trading hub for four centuries.

name: augsburg-confession
description: Lutheran princes presented their confession of faith to Emperor Charles V, formally establishing Protestant doctrine.

name: pizarro-executes-atahualpa
description: Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro executed the Inca emperor Atahualpa despite receiving history's largest ransom.

name: dissolution-of-monasteries
description: Henry VIII began dissolving English monasteries, seizing their wealth and redistributing lands to loyal supporters.

name: servetus-burned-at-stake
description: Michael Servetus was burned for heresy in Calvin's Geneva for denying the Trinity, showing Protestant intolerance of dissent.

name: mercator-projection-map
description: Gerardus Mercator published his world map with a new projection that enabled straight-line navigation, revolutionizing seafaring.

name: execution-mary-queen-scots
friendly_name: Execution of Mary Queen of Scots
description: Elizabeth I executed her Catholic cousin Mary Stuart after years of imprisonment, removing a rival claimant to the English throne.

name: first-korean-turtle-ships
description: Admiral Yi Sun-sin deployed armored turtle ships against the Japanese navy, helping Korea resist Toyotomi Hideyoshi's invasion.

name: giordano-bruno-burned
description: The philosopher Giordano Bruno was burned at the stake in Rome for heresy, including his belief in an infinite universe.

name: gunpowder-plot
description: Guy Fawkes and Catholic conspirators attempted to blow up Parliament and King James I, but the plot was discovered and foiled.

name: defenestration-of-prague
description: Protestant nobles threw Catholic officials from a window in Prague Castle, sparking the Thirty Years' War.

name: great-migration-massachusetts
description: Over 20,000 Puritans migrated to Massachusetts Bay Colony in a decade, establishing English Protestant settlements in New England.

name: galileos-trial
description: The Inquisition tried Galileo for supporting heliocentrism, forcing him to recant and placing him under house arrest for life.

name: putney-debates
description: New Model Army officers and soldiers debated England's future constitution, with radicals arguing for expanded voting rights.

name: treaty-of-pereyaslav
description: Ukrainian Cossacks agreed to Russian protection, beginning the process that would bring Ukraine under Muscovite control.

name: treaty-of-rastatt
description: Austria and France ended the War of Spanish Succession, with Austria gaining the Spanish Netherlands and Italian territories.

name: treaty-of-nystad
description: Russia and Sweden ended the Great Northern War, with Russia gaining Baltic territories and emerging as a major European power.
